com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue

Interface YCPRecalculateCreditedMinsUE


  • public interface YCPRecalculateCreditedMinsUE
    User exit that allows recalculation of CreditedMinutes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double recalculateCreditedMins(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The YCPRecalculateCreditedMinsUE user exit is called by the modifyProductivity and createProductivity APIs after calculating Credited Minutes.

    • Method Detail

      • recalculateCreditedMins

        double recalculateCreditedMins(YFSEnvironment env,
                               org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                        throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YCPRecalculateCreditedMinsUE user exit is called by the modifyProductivity and createProductivity APIs after calculating Credited Minutes.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.

        The user exit implementation can get the enterprise code from the environment variable by calling the getUEParam(String variable) method. Example : env.getUEParam("EnterpriseCode");


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: None.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        inXML - Required. An XML to recompute credited minutes as required by recalculateCreditedMins user exit. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        Recalculated CreditedMinutes.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
